Directions: Near pond.Middle plot.
S of HMHD.  Adjacent to the pond. 1st plot.

Directions: Deer run to Marsh shortcut to Chickadee loop (shelter).  Past KENDRY.  Turn E into stand.  Right side of trail.

Directions: Left side of Chickadee trail .  Enter stand at flagged cherry.  NE from KENDRY.

Directions: Take trail to the left toward point #12.  Turn left before shortcut.  Turn left (South) into stand past point # 11 (Life in Layers)

Directions: SW of HMDRY
Directions_updated_2024: From witness tree (flagged 32.7 cm cherry): turn 255 degrees and go 2.7 meters

Directions: S of HMDRY2.  Down slight slope and past large rock pile.

Directions: Deer run to Swamp shortcut to Chickadee loop (shelter).  Turn right into stand at marked cherry.  Four-stemmed ash at the edge of the trail.

Directions: Enter Chickadee loop near shelter.  Go right into stand at marked elm tree.  On same side as KENUP.

Directions: Park at open area to left.  Cross road to gated path. Take path past wet area and enter stand at right where ground is dry.

Directions: Continue on Chickadee loop from KENDRY2.  Look for flagged elm at right.  Flagged center will be visible from trail.

Directions: Walk left up park road and look for flagged red maple sapling right side of road.  Turn right at flagged tree.  Plot is ~40 m from road.

Directions: Park at top of Boat Launch Rd. off Bass Lake Rd.  Plot is down hill in low area before foot bridge.
First of 2 plots on top of hill/ridge. Head NE off trail before trail turns left. Closest of the 3 plots to parking lot.
Plot is North of parking lot.(befpre bridge). Go about 320 ' into woods.  Plot is very close to pkg. lot.

Duck Lake Rd. to Livingston Rd.  Pkg on rt. Trail across rd.-stay left until T intersection.  Trail goes under road.  Turn left on seldom used trail w/8 on trail marker.  It faces the opposite way.  Turn right to find 1st  plot.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Sugar maple - red oak - bitternut hickory - beech - elm in wet section. There is an approx 4.5 cm black ash at 17 meters. It has lots of bark splits and epicormics.

Directions: Turn left out of plot on xc ski trail from HLMAT. On rt. look for sm. flagged beech & woody debris/huge downed tree.  Turn right go up hill. Stream is N of plot.

ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Lots of sugar maple - beech - Ostrya - smooth barked hickory - maybe a tuliptree
Center_tree_updated_2024: 48.5 cm Acer saccharum - tree tag missing - only 1 microplot PVC found - no rebar found - map and GARMIN match the tree we found

Directions: Cross small bridge over stream and turn left into stand up the hill at carved beech tree. Go uphill total distance hiked from parking lot is ~1.4 mi.

Directions: Boat Launch Rd. off Bass Lake Rd.  Take trail in past wet area & cross bridge over stream.  Plot on right side (N) of trail, very close to trail. Enter woods at flagged cherry.

Directions: Same as above. Before powerline.   Plot on right side of trail, very close to trail.

Directions: Same as above. Take trail past power line. Plot N of trail, very close to trail in white pine stand.

Directions: Same as above, take trail past power line. Plot lies E (rt. Of PLCONF). Very close to trail off rt. side.

Directions: Same as above, take trail past powerlines.  Plot  immed. E. of #34, and #35. Very close to trail off right side.

Directions: Take River trail. Turn N (L) into stand. After 2nd or 3rd?  boardwalk. Middle plot.
Directions_updated_2024: about 10 ft and 190 degrees from a 21.2 cm DBH dying Acer with 2 main branches

Directions: Poison sumac in your face. Take River trail. Turn NW into stand at beginning of 1st or 2nd? board walk.

Directions: Park at NC, take Deer Run trail ~100 ft. 1st plot closest to NC on left side of trail.

Center_tree_updated_2024: 7.9 cm musclewood 1-stem (the other stem is down)

Directions: 6th Kenwet plot.Deer run trail, cross boardwalk over marsh.  Go in on rt. side not straight in. Before squirrel sign. Last plot on left where Kamal got stuck.

Center_tree: Carpinus 9.0 cm.     New ctr.2.25 m. from orig.

Directions: 2nd Kenwet plot.  Deer run trail to flagged 2-stemed ash at left.  Uphill.

Directions: Gale Rd. trail to T intersection (~.15mi), go left around the bend and up hill.  Go L (SW) into stand at flag.  On top of ridge.

Gale Rd.  to flagged elm.  Go east (R) into stand. Closest poneast plot to trail.

Directions: Gale Rd. trail to second flagged tree on right side of trail.  Enter stand and head east.  Follow GPS to PONRT. Way back  in middle.On hill looks down on swamp. Annie's

Directions: Paper wasp nest in ground at E 18m. Gale Rd. path to T-intersection.  Take path to right.  Flagged hickory 3-4 m from trail on right marks entrance to plot. Annie's

Directions: Gale Rd. trail to flagged red maple on right side of trail. Turn right into stand at large forked red oak. Scraggly.  Annie's

Directions: Park at Riverbend picnic area and take yellow path.  Riparian area is on right before you come to bridge over Huron River.  Plot closest to river and bridge, not far in on left.
Go SE from ILRIP. Plot at back. (Most North)

Directions: South of ILRIP2. Plot closest to trail on right.
(Canoe camp) Park across  road. Enter at gate on 2 track..  Take trail to the left at outhouse.  At canoe camp #2 enter woods heading SE to flagged black ash tree

Directions: SW from ILCC. Forested dry area.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Beech - sugar maple - American hophornbeam - Tilia - Carpinus - Prunus - swamp white oak - silver maple - elm in flooded part - cottonwood. Some ash in the 8-9 cm range (maybe white or green)

Directions: Contine S from ILCC2.  Last plot of the three-- often under H20.

ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Water 2-3 feet deep.
Center_tree_updated_2024: Tree dead - approx 14 cm DBH - Note: found only 1 PVC and the tree tag. Ran out of time to replace other PVCs.

Directions: Take Nature Trail through construction area, meadow, stay to left.  Enter woods on left before reaching old stove landmark on trail.
Center_tree_updated_2024: 24.7 cm + 23.7 cm 2-stem Acer saccharum - tree tag likely swallowed

Directions: SE of ISMATDRY. Head toward the back.
Take Nature Trail to old stove, go left into plot past ISDRYMAT.  Use GPS to navigate to plot.  Old wire fence runs across SE quadrant of plot.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: The site has a wetter (south) side that is covered with interesting sedges and grasses (along with elms - silver maple - swamp white oak - musclewood). The drier side of the site is beech - sugar maple - red oak

Directions: (low ash density) Wet plots. NWest of ISMATDRY2.  Enter stand past old stove landmark, before bridge, follow deer trail to right.  Head SE.
Directions_updated_2024: Witness tree: 12.9 cm Acer saccharum that is shaped as an elbow is 4.3 m - 315 degrees to the C. caroliniana
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: There are lots of about 5 cm DBH black ash in the 8-18 m. They have some older epicormic sprouts and some bad bark splitting.
Center_tree_updated_2024: 4.7 cm + 3.0 cm + 5.4 cm + 10.8 cm 4-stem (2 of the six stems must have died)

Directions: South of ISLD, closest to road.  Can be under water.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: There are many green and black ash trees in the 5-10 cm range in the 8-18 m. The green seem to grow to bigger sizes before being killed - while the black ash die around about 8 cm.
Center_tree_updated_2024: 18.9 cm Acer saccharinum (tree tag partly swallowed)

Directions: West of ISLD just NW of 3 large tamaraks.  Farthest back close to road.

Center_tree_updated_2024: 29.8 cm Quercus rubra - tree tag missing

Directions: NE of ISMATDE.  Short distance from trail.  Take nature trail, turn left (SE) into woods at very large  beech about 4 m from trail edge.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Dominated by swamp white oak (falling over) - hickories - maples. Sparse understory - with some very interesting sedges and grasses
Center_tree_updated_2024: 55.2 cm Quercus bicolor - tree tag missing

Directions: SE of ISMATDE2.  Cross low, wet area, beware of wire fence that runs through W side of stand. Farthest back of group.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: See rows 75_north and 75_south
We found 2 locations where a center tree was (both had microplot PVCs). Denote 75_south for the one with a fallen tree - 75_north for the other one

Directions_updated_2024: To get from 75_north to 75_south: point 220 degrees and go 23 meters
Center_tree_updated_2024: Tree is fallen (tag is still visible)

Directions: Farthest back.  From #77 go W back into open woods w/stream on right. To exit go S thru tangle, skunk cabbage, forest, & watch out for downed fence before trail.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Very flooded: about 1.5 ft of standing water

Directions: 2nd plot.  W. of ISRIP3 #78. Before remains of old bridge over stream.
Directions_updated_2024: 200 degrees from a gigantic 6-stem maple

Directions: Turn right into stand at tilting bench on right side of trail.  Down slight incline.  Center tree visible from bench. Plot numbers run backwards in transect.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: The area is covered in fallen ash trees. Tall grasses have taken over. Mix of black and green ash in the non-flooded area. Flooded = grasses.

Directions: Farthest back plot in Fairy Tale Forest. Take trail past stove, bridge etc. to fork in trail.  Take path to right.  Turn right (E) into stand about 25 feet before reaching large beech tree with J + A carved into it.  Plot is NE of ISOPEN3.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Maples - hickory - red oak - tuliptree - Tilia - elms in flooded part
Center_tree_updated_2024: 42.8 cm Quercus rubra (on a big mound)

Directions: Take trail past stove, bridge.  Bench  in open area on L side of trail is a landmark to enter the stand at right (E).  If you come to fork in the trail you've gone too far. Before Fairy Tale Forest.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Bitternut hickory - red oak - sugar maple - cherry - swamp white oak - understory covered in ash seedlings

Directions: Take trail past stove, bridge.  Take right trail at fork past 2nd shelter.  Turn into stand at right (SE) at Y-shaped beech tree with hollow at base which sits ~9m from trail edge.  Plot is 1.11 mi from Nature Ctr.  Middle plot.
Directions_updated_2024: From a 4-stem Tilia (25.2 cm is the smallest stem): go 288 degrees and ? Meters.

Directions: Farthest back transect at Haven Hill area. Park at Haven Hill Lake parking lot.  Take nature trail at N end of parking lot.  Cross dam.  Stay to right 1st fork in trail (white & yellow foot trail).  Stay left at 2nd fork (shubby oak on right and tall grass at left).  Stay to right, stream on left, wetland on right.
Directions_updated_2024: Witness tree: shaggy barked hickory (46.8 cm)(flagged). From the hickory: go 286 degrees and 10.77 meters.
Center_tree_updated_2024: Tree decomposed. I moved the rebar about a foot to get it out from under a log.

Directions: See directions above.SW of HLMATFR.  Behind HLMATFR.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Many maples - Carpinus - Ostrya

Directions: Go back out to trail from HLMATFR2.  Turn left, heading west.  Last plot on left.
Directions_updated_2024: About 3 meters North of a large tip-up mound. Witness: 2-stem Ostrya (11 cm + 4.9 cm). From this tree: go 113 degrees and 5.6 meters to get to center.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Red oaks - sugar maple - beech - hickory

Directions: Park at Haven Hill.  Take nature trail at N end of parking lot.  Plot is on R side of trail (E) on hill between trail and park road.  Enter at meteor rock. Middle plot up hill from 86.
Directions_updated_2024: From between the two Populus on the path (on map): go 80 degrees and 20.0 meters. Witness tree: 7.7 cm sugar maple. From this: go 154 degrees and 3.80 meters to get to center.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: White oak - sugar maple - Populus (bigtooth aspen?) - cherry - swamp white oak (?) - red oak - beech - white oak - swampy part has an interesting sedge (see photo)
Center_tree_updated_2024: We cannot find the center tree. We found 2 microplots as well as a depression where a tree once was. The North and West microplots were replaced.

Directions: Park at Haven Hill.  Enter stand at right at "meteor" (large porous rock)  on the right side of trail.  Plot is SE of HLRIP
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: There are lots of little ash seedlings (below 137 cm). There are also lots of invasive plants like Autumn olive - bittersweet (Celastrus I think) - barberry - multiflora rose - and others. Also two different types of dogwood - maybe a viburnum - lots of bigger oaks - basswood. There were a couple of ash trees (about 7-10 cm DBH) that were entirely dead. Would they be why there are so many ash seedlings?

Directions: NE of HLRIP.  Can enter at bend in trail or go downhill from #85 HLRIP.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Flooded area in the 8-18 m (North side) has some black ash small trees. Tilia - sugar or red maple - cherry - beech - bitternut hickory (?) - some musclewood (dying)

Directions: Park at Haven Hill.  Take nature trail at N end of parking lot.  Go past marker 14 on CC ski trail.  Plot is on hill to left of trail.  Enter stand opposite large dead debarked tree on right of path (next to white oak with large canker about 15ft up).  Before HLMATFR on left hillside.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: A slightly open area in the East is filled with Desmodium (tick-trefoil) and a mystery herbaceous plant (see photo). Dogwoods are doing well in the open areas. Most of the plot has large oaks (likely red oak)(see acorn photo)(leaf litter is dominated by red oak) - some red maple

Directions: W of HLUP, on hillside facing the lake
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: White oaks - hickories - red maple - Sassafras - red or black oak - Ostrya. Wet part to the South has cattail - poison sumac.

Directions: Go uphill, (N) and to the right so that trail is straight ahead (N).  NW of HLUP, NE of HLUP2

Center_tree_updated_2024: 25.6 cm beech - tree tag partly swallowed

Directions: Angle more E, little S toward back, from ISWH2
Directions_updated_2024: Witness tree (also flagged) is a 10.6 cm sugar (?) maple. From this witness - point 108 degrees and go 5.44 meters to get to the center tree
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: Lots of ash seedlings. A few small ash trees in the 8-18 m. Sugar maples - oaks in the red oak group - maybe Populus spp.
Center_tree_updated_2024: Acer spp. Has fallen and is partly covered by a large fallen hickory. Created a witness tree.

Directions: Uphill from KENUPHD.  Go past KENUPHD3, NW from it.
Directions_updated_2024: Witness tree: black walnut 63.2 cm (flagged). West PVC is in the equestrian path by a few feet. We put a PVC slightly nearer to the center than 8 m
Center_tree_updated_2024: Center tree down. Center tree does have PVC and metal stake.

Directions: Go past KENNEW towards the dirt road and fence in the back of the stand, more NW.
ash_plot_centers_notes_2024: North and West microplots are in the equestrian path - those PVCs were not placed

Directions: NE of KENNEW & KENNEW2
